problem_statement: The string_utils.py module contains a reverse_string() function that works correctly for ASCII text but fails when handling Unicode characters, especially emoji and combining characters. The function uses naive string slicing (text[::-1]) which breaks Unicode surrogate pairs and combining character sequences. This causes the is_palindrome() function that depends on it to also fail for Unicode text. Fix the reverse_string() function to properly handle all Unicode characters while maintaining backward compatibility for ASCII text.
expected_patch: Replace the naive text[::-1] reversal with proper Unicode-aware reversal that preserves grapheme clusters and combining character sequences.
